snippet: When Katrina DeJesus couldn’t afford a burial for her son, who lived only 90 minutes, she let New York City bury him. Now the city says it doesn’t know where his body is.
abstract: Katrina DeJesus is suing New York City for losing body of her infant son, who died 90 minutes after birth; boy was supposedly buried in potters field on Hart Island but city admits it has no official record; suit charges city with negligence and violating sepulcher rights to bury one's own relatives.
lead_paragraph: When Katrina DeJesus couldn’t afford a burial for her son, who lived only 90 minutes, she let New York City bury him. Now the city says it doesn’t know where his body is.

headline.main: Allowed to Visit Her Baby’s Grave After 12 Years, a Woman Is Told: Your Son Isn’t Here
headline.print_headline: Wrenching Words on First Trip to Son’s Grave: He Isn’t Here

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Office of the Chief Medical Examiner of the City of New York
